places.name: Golden Bridge (Cau Vang)
places.description: Iconic pedestrian bridge featuring two massive stone hands appearing to cradle a golden walkway at 1,414 meters elevation, offering breathtaking panoramic views of Ba Na Hills.
places.why_visit: One of the world's most photographed bridges, recognized globally by CNN and featured in major international media for its stunning architectural design and mountain vistas.

places.name: Marble Mountains (Ngu Hanh Son)
places.description: Five limestone and marble peaks named after the five elements of Eastern philosophy, featuring intricate cave systems, Buddhist shrines dating back to the 17th century, and stunning coastal views.
places.why_visit: A sacred spiritual destination combining natural wonder with cultural heritage, offering exploration of mystical caves, ancient pagodas, and panoramic views of Non Nuoc Beach.

places.name: Lady Buddha Statue at Linh Ung Pagoda
places.description: Vietnam's tallest Buddha statue at 67 meters, featuring 17 floors with 27 Buddha statues for worship, overlooking the East Sea from Son Tra Peninsula.
places.why_visit: An awe-inspiring symbol of peace and serenity offering spiritual significance and spectacular coastal views from one of Da Nang's most revered religious sites.

places.name: My Khe Beach
places.description: Nine-kilometer stretch of pristine white sand and clear turquoise waters, named by Forbes as one of the most attractive beaches on the planet.
places.why_visit: Perfect for swimming, surfing, and relaxation with its gentle waves, powdery sand, and stunning mountain backdrop, all within easy reach of the city center.

places.name: Dragon Bridge (Cau Rong)
places.description: The world's largest dragon-shaped steel bridge spanning 666 meters across the Han River, featuring 15,000 LED lights and spectacular fire-breathing and water-spraying performances.
places.why_visit: Witness an unforgettable spectacle every weekend at 9 PM when the dragon breathes fire and sprays water, symbolizing Da Nang's thriving modern development.

places.name: Ba Na Hills
places.description: French-style hilltop resort at 1,500 meters elevation featuring world-record cable cars, amusement parks, gardens, and the famous Golden Bridge.
places.why_visit: Experience a unique blend of European architecture and Vietnamese mountain scenery via one of CNN's top 10 most impressive cable car systems, offering year-round cool climate.

places.name: Son Tra Peninsula (Monkey Mountain)
places.description: 60-square-kilometer pristine peninsula featuring lush tropical forests, rare red-shanked douc langurs, secluded beaches, and the towering Lady Buddha statue.
places.why_visit: Discover untouched natural beauty and spot endangered wildlife while enjoying panoramic coastal views just 10 kilometers from downtown Da Nang.

places.name: Museum of Cham Sculpture
places.description: World's largest collection of Cham sculpture with over 300 artifacts reflecting the ancient Champa civilization's lifestyle, culture, and intricate Hindu god carvings.
places.why_visit: Essential for understanding Central Vietnam's rich history through masterpieces of Cham art spanning from the 7th to 15th centuries.

places.name: Han Market (Cho Han)
places.description: Da Nang's central market bustling with hundreds of stalls offering local produce, seafood, textiles, souvenirs, and authentic Vietnamese street food.
places.why_visit: Immerse yourself in local culture and sample authentic Mi Quang noodles, fresh seafood, and shop for Vietnamese specialties in the heart of the city.

places.name: Non Nuoc Beach
places.description: Five-kilometer pristine coastline at the foot of Marble Mountains, featuring white powdery sand, turquoise water, and coconut palms with fewer crowds than My Khe.
places.why_visit: Experience tranquil beach paradise with stunning mountain backdrop, perfect for those seeking peaceful relaxation away from the busier tourist areas.
